turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cusco.
turn.1: What's the deal with Qurikancha in Cusco?
turn.2: The Qurikancha ("golden place") was the most important sanctuary dedicated to the Sun God (Inti) at the time of the Inca Empire.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: According to ancient chronicles written by Garcilaso de la Vega (chronicler), Qurikancha was said to have featured a large solid golden disc that was studded with precious stones and represented the Inca Sun God – Inti.
turn.5: Is there anything else that's important about Qurikancha?
turn.6: Spanish chroniclers describe the Sacred Garden in front of the temple as a garden of golden plants with leaves of beaten gold, stems of silver, solid gold corn-cobs and 20 life-size llamas and their herders all in solid gold.
turn.7: Is anything left of Qurikancha today?
turn.8: The temple was destroyed by its Spanish invaders who, as they plundered, were determined to rid the city of its wealth, idolaters and shrines.
turn.9: Is there any part of Qurikancha that's still standing?
turn.10: Nowadays, only a curved outer wall and partial ruins of the inner temple remain at the site.
turn.11: What's interesting about the curved outer wall?
